titleStmt.title: The Jesuites intrigues with the private instructions of that society to their emissaries. The first, translated out of a book privately printed at Paris. The second, lately found in manuscript in a Jesuites closet after his death. Both sent with a letter from a gentleman at Paris, to his friend in London.
titleStmt.author: Gentleman at Paris. aut
Compton, Henry, 1632-1713.
Zahorowski, Hieronim. Monita secreta Societatis Jesu. English.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Ric. Chiswell, at the Rose and Crown in St. Paul's Church-Yard,

notesStmt.note: Original title of "The Jesuites intrigues" not traced. "The Jesuites private instructions" (quires E-I) is a translation of: Zahorowski, Hieronim. Monita secreta Societatis Jesu.
First leaf and last leaf are blank.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
